content.description:
Hueco Traverse starts on the R Arete on slopers and traverse's all the way around finishing up on Hueco Finish (V1).

Arguably sandbagged at V7, drop low after you turn the corner to a seriously heinous pinch/undercling (starting from here is Hueco Direct V6) and keep going farther left and up to finish. The Easy Out (V5) goes up the the L Arete on small crimps from the rail before turning the corner and dropping down.
content.location: Starts right on two large huecos. Traverse left.

content.description: Begin on nice hueco jugs and pop feet onto a well polished stemming move. Directly up edges to the top.
content.location: On the narrow face closest to the road.

content.description: Start with hands in the obvious juggy huecos sitting above a low roof.  Crank up to a side pull on the right and then to a huge jug.  From there, you should be able to figure out an easy topout.
content.location: As you hike the trail from the parking lot along the road you will see a boulder with two huge huecos on its east face just past the Chaos and Flat Top Boulders.
